channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report I-2024090041
item.description:
Report I-2024090041

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: Las Vegas
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 09/18/2024, hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL LAS Service Center, 5280 W Badura Ave, Suite 100, Las Vegas, NV 89118 Transportation by road has been confirmed.' Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium batteries contained in equipment U.. Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 1.0 kg Amount in Package: 1.0 kg Number in Shipment: 18 Number Failed: 18

item.title: Report X-2024091408
item.description:
Report X-2024091408

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/20/2024 at approximately 1011 Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 817392 at the staion location in Las Vegas, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered leaking from the bottom of the box. Further investigation revealed the plastic container contained iron, steel, nickel blackener and it spilled from the closure. An online safety data sheet classifed this commodity as UN3264 ; however, the shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the markings, labels, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.
